verses.verse: Canst thou draw out <S%H4900><s%> leviathan <S%H3882><s%> with a fishhook <S%H2443><s%>? Or press down his tongue <S%H3956><s%> with a cord <S%H2256><s%>?
Canst thou put <S%H7760><s%> a rope <S%H100><s%> into his nose <S%H639><s%>? Or pierce <S%H5344><s%> his jaw <S%H3895><s%> through with a hook <S%H2336><s%>?
Will he make many <S%H7235><s%> supplications <S%H8469><s%> unto thee <S%H1696><s%>? Or will he speak soft words unto thee <S%H7390><s%>?
Will he make <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> with thee <S%H3947><s%>, That thou shouldest take him for a servant <S%H5650><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>?
Wilt thou play <S%H7832><s%> with him as with a bird <S%H6833><s%>? Or wilt thou bind <S%H7194><s%> him for thy maidens <S%H5291><s%>?
Will the bands <S%H2271><s%> of fishermen make traffic <S%H3739><s%> of him <S%H2673><s%>? Will they part him among the merchants <S%H3669><s%>?
Canst thou fill <S%H4390><s%> his skin <S%H5785><s%> with barbed irons <S%H7905><s%>, Or his head with fish <S%H7218><s%> - spears?
Lay <S%H7760><s%> thy hand <S%H3709><s%> upon him <S%H2142><s%>; Remember the battle <S%H4421><s%>, and do so no more <S%H3254><s%>.
Behold <S%H8431><s%>, the hope of him is in vain <S%H3576><s%>: Will not one be cast down <S%H2904><s%> even at the sight of him <S%H4758><s%>?
None is so fierce <S%H393><s%> that he dare stir him up <S%H5782><s%>; Who then is he that can stand <S%H3320><s%> before me <S%H6440><s%>?
Who hath first given <S%H6923><s%> unto me <S%H7999><s%>, that I should repay him <S%H8064><s%>? Whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.
I will not keep silence concerning <S%H2790><s%> his limbs <S%H907><s%>, Nor his mighty strength <S%H1369><s%>, nor his goodly <S%H2433><s%> frame <S%H6187><s%>.
Who can strip <S%H1540><s%> off his outer <S%H6440><s%> garment <S%H3830><s%>? Who shall come <S%H935><s%> within <S%H3718><s%> his jaws <S%H7448><s%>?
Who can open <S%H6605><s%> the doors <S%H1817><s%> of his face <S%H6440><s%>? Round about <S%H5439><s%> his teeth <S%H8127><s%> is terror <S%H367><s%>.
His strong scales <S%H4043><s%> are his pride <S%H1346><s%>, Shut up together <S%H5462><s%> as with a close <S%H6862><s%> seal <S%H2368><s%>.
One <S%H259><s%> is so near <S%H5066><s%> to another <S%H259><s%>, That no air <S%H7307><s%> can come between them <S%H935><s%>.
They are joined <S%H1692><s%> one <S%H376><s%> to another <S%H251><s%>; They stick together <S%H3920><s%>, so that they cannot be sundered <S%H6504><s%>.
His sneezings <S%H5846><s%> flash <S%H1984><s%> forth light <S%H216><s%>, And his eyes <S%H5869><s%> are like the eyelids <S%H6079><s%> of the morning <S%H7837><s%>.
Out of his mouth <S%H6310><s%> go <S%H1980><s%> burning torches <S%H3940><s%>, And sparks <S%H3590><s%> of fire <S%H784><s%> leap forth <S%H4422><s%>.
Out of his nostrils <S%H5156><s%> a smoke <S%H6227><s%> goeth <S%H3318><s%>, As of a boiling <S%H5301><s%> pot <S%H1731><s%> and burning rushes <S%H100><s%>.
His breath <S%H5315><s%> kindleth <S%H3857><s%> coals <S%H1513><s%>, And a flame <S%H3851><s%> goeth forth <S%H3318><s%> from his mouth <S%H6310><s%>.
In his neck <S%H6677><s%> abideth <S%H3885><s%> strength <S%H5797><s%>, And terror <S%H1670><s%> danceth <S%H1750><s%> before him <S%H6440><s%>.
The flakes <S%H4651><s%> of his flesh <S%H1320><s%> are joined together <S%H1692><s%>: They are firm <S%H3332><s%> upon him <S%H4131><s%>; They cannot be moved.
His heart <S%H3820><s%> is as firm <S%H3332><s%> as a stone <S%H68><s%>; Yea <S%H3332><s%>, firm as the nether <S%H8482><s%> millstone <S%H6400><s%>.
When he raiseth himself up <S%H7613><s%>, the mighty <S%H352><s%> are afraid <S%H1481><s%>: By reason of consternation <S%H7667><s%> they are beside themselves <S%H2398><s%>.
If one lay <S%H5381><s%> at him with the sword <S%H2719><s%>, it cannot avail <S%H6965><s%>; Nor the spear <S%H2595><s%>, the dart <S%H4551><s%>, nor the pointed shaft <S%H8302><s%>.
He counteth <S%H2803><s%> iron <S%H1270><s%> as straw <S%H8401><s%>, And brass <S%H5154><s%> as rotten <S%H7539><s%> wood <S%H6086><s%>.
The arrow <S%H1121><s%> cannot make him flee <S%H1272><s%>: Sling-stones <S%H68><s%> are turned <S%H2015><s%> with him into stubble <S%H7179><s%>.
Clubs <S%H8455><s%> are counted <S%H2803><s%> as stubble <S%H7179><s%>: He laugheth <S%H7832><s%> at the rushing <S%H7494><s%> of the javelin <S%H3591><s%>.
His underparts are like sharp <S%H2303><s%> potsherds <S%H2789><s%>: He spreadeth <S%H7502><s%> as it were a threshing-wain <S%H2742><s%> upon the mire <S%H2916><s%>.
He maketh the deep <S%H4688><s%> to boil <S%H7570><s%> like a pot <S%H5518><s%>: He maketh <S%H7760><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%> like a pot of ointment <S%H4841><s%>.
He maketh a path <S%H5410><s%> to shine <S%H215><s%> after <S%H310><s%> him <S%H2803><s%>; One would think the deep <S%H8415><s%> to be hoary <S%H7872><s%>.
Upon earth <S%H6083><s%> there is not his like <S%H4915><s%>, That is made <S%H6213><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> fear <S%H2844><s%>.
He beholdeth <S%H7200><s%> everything that is high <S%H1364><s%>: He is king <S%H4428><s%> over all the sons <S%H1121><s%> of pride <S%H7830><s%>.
